data.title: Configuration change events and workspace folder changes
data.body:
Consider the following steps:

- a file A is opened
- the user adds a workspace folder which contains file A
- this basically changes the 'configuration' for file A from a user configuration for a folder configuration

Some happens in the opposite case when a workspace folder is removed and files contained inside the folder stay open.

Should we signal the configuration change through a configuration change event?

data.title: EH Debugging: Loaded Scripts Explorer stays empty for "inspector" protocol

data.title: package.json git location mismatch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15
- OS Version: Manjaro Linux KDE Kernel 4.9

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a VSCode extension `yo code`
2. Create a `CHANGELOG.md` file
3. Use git diff view on `CHANGELOG.md`
4. `package.json` error is shown.

data.title: Integrated terminal should handle mouse scrolling in curses-style interfaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#### Summary

Scrolling within the integrated terminal doesn't scroll curses interfaces such as `less`, `vim`, `git log`, etc.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
#### System setup

- VSCode Version: Version 1.15.0 8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2
- OS Version: Arch Linux
- Shell: ZSH (oh-my-zsh)

#### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the integrated terminal (`` Ctrl+` ``)
2. Open a curses style pager interface (e.g. `less`, `git log`, `git diff`, `vim`)
3. Use the mouse scrollwheel to try and scroll the pager
5. Nothing happens, using keyboard commands to scroll works fine (`j`, `k`, `PgUp`, `PgDown`, arrow keys, etc)

#### Compare with expected behaviour:

1. Open a seperate terminal (e.g. `gnome-terminal` or `tilix`)
2. Repeat step 2 & 3 above
3. Works as expected; pager scrolls

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Cannot update extensions:  permissions issue?
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (baa6fbece9035e3d20cbcb776d73ebc6c4ddde26, 2017-08-15T05:08:02.380Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- ng-template|Ang|0.1.4 code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2 sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0 html-snippets|abu|0.1.0 Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2 project-manager|ale|0.19.0 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 tslint|eg2|0.17.0 auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14 Angular2|joh|2.4.0 ecdc|mit|0.10.3 HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3 vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.1.2 vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.5.0 angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17 stylelint|shi|0.28.0 ayu|tea|0.4.0 change-case|wma|1.0.0 (4 theme extensions excluded) --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Last week I got a new Macbook Pro. To preserve my extensions and themes, I copied the `.vscode-insiders` folder from my old home folder to my new one. I've been using code without incident. 2. Today, I was prompted to update an extension, a theme called Ayu. 3. I click the update button, but get this dialog: The console has this message: ```` messageService.ts:125 EACCES: permission denied, mkdir '/Users/st016lo/.vscode-insiders/extensions/teabyii.ayu-0.5.0': Error: EACCES: permission denied, mkdir '/Users/st016lo/.vscode-insiders/extensions/teabyii.ayu-0.5.0' ````

data.title: Explorer: allow to collapse a sub-tree fully via Alt-click
data.body: Alt+click should collapse recursively in the explorer.

data.title: Contributable SearchProvider
data.body:
This PR contains an experiment to apply the "provider-pattern" to our search logic (find *in* and *for* files). This is part of the larger remote development scenario. 

[edited with details and more ideas]

The API should cover two purposed, searching for and in files and IMO there should be two APIs/providers for this. Let's gather some requirements:

### Search For Files

**Ways to express what you are looking for**

* simple patterns ala `*.png`
* glob patterns ala `{**/*.test.ts,src/**/*.js}`
* regular expressions
* subsequent character matches, like `foa` matches `i Find characters in the Order in which they Appear in the query`
* string substring match, like `foa` only matches `foa the people`

FYI - today the extension API already allows to [`findFiles`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/joh/searchp/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L4785) and it allows to define queries using glob-patterns;

**Results**

I think it's fair to define the result as a stream of `Uri`s. They are easy to create and VS Code handles them well. Questions might be

* Sorting/Ranking? Each provider might be smart and return results by it's own sort order. However, that is always local and it's not sure how they compare against each other. 
* Upper bounds? In VS Code we usually don't return more then 1000 results


### Search In Files

**Ways to express what you are looking for**

* regular expressions
* substring match

Unsure if we need to define the exact regex feature set or if this should be more pragmatic and just be a best effort approach where each provider can decide how to interpret a query

**Results**

* We need a way to preview them in context. Today we use the full line of a match but that doesn't work well with very long lines. Maybe we spec the preview to be at least the matching range but ideally plus/minus N characters
* Offsets or position bases? A search match inside a file must denote the location in that file. Our API always talks about positions (line and character) and not offsets. It might be a challenge for some providers to provide that information and we should be fit for that, e.g allow to fill in that information later.

data.title: VS Code 1.15.0 jumps into wrong file line from Search menu in both 32 and 64bit Code editions
data.body:
<!-- Please see the debugging tips in the README.md before filing an issue. Especially the tip about using the `.scripts` command. -->

Visual Code is jumping into wrong line in result file from Search menu, since version 1.13, on Windows 10 64bit 1703 - with non extensions installed even after removing 32bit and installing 64bit version the problem still occurs every time.

- VS Code Version: 1.15.0 32bit and 64bit

Steps to reproduce:

1. Search for string in Search menu
2. Click on Search results in any file 
3. Code will jump into wrong line most of the time
4. After closing and opening that file in editor and cliking again will solve the problem for that file only
5. If you click on other results lines in files will reoccur the bug again

This happens in all files not any certain file or project.

data.title: Add support for sign in to app and synchronize settings, plugins previously installed and others preferences.
data.body: I think that feature can improve productivity when is necessary to use a different computer to code or re-install the software for some reason. This feature will work similary as we can see on google chrome now.

data.title: EH debugging: "Restart" results in two debug sessions
data.body:
- VS Code: Insiders with "inspector" based EH debugging
- OS: all

Pressing the "Restart" button on the debug floating window restarts the EH process just fine but in many cases results in a second debug session which makes the session drop down appear on the debug floating window.

Most likely this is a timing issue: a new session appears before the old session has terminated.

FYI @roblourens

data.title: Git commands
data.body: - VSCode Version: Latest - OS Version: Win 10 x64 Hi guys will there be a way to customize the Git commands in VSCode ? For example in my work environment we're working with Gerrit and each time we update the code base we need to `git fetch && git rebase` in order to update the code base because Gerrit doesn't allow me to merge branches the same goes for seperate branches is there a way to enter custom commands for Git in VSCode or to fetch && rebase to a given branch from origin/master - the closest I've come is the 'Pull (Rebase)' in the Git section on the SIde Panel of VSCode - or you know you the terminal :D . Ok thanks guys.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. just make a <script></script> Tag inside any html document
2. just start to make 'comments' in there aka // or /**/
3. click in one of those commented lines:

[Error - 14:02:02] Request textDocument/documentHighlight failed.
  Message: Request textDocument/documentHighlight failed with message: Cannot read property 'kind' of undefined
  Code: -32603 

4. this won't happen if it is a .js file.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Toggle the block comment without having to select it

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: windows10



There is a problem that bothers me. **If I want to remove the block comment, I have to select it**, like this:

![](http://oe9d7h5y3.bkt.clouddn.com/select.png)

If I do not select it, and go to toggle block comment, it becomes:

![](http://oe9d7h5y3.bkt.clouddn.com/select2.png)

Have you a good idea to solve it?

**PS**: I use this hot key `ctrl+shift+/` to toggle block comments, which was bound to the command  `editor.action.blockComment`


Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: VSCode >= 1.13 greys out audio controls in previewHTML?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: >= 1.13
- OS Version: OSX, Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use any extension that will allow you to preview HTML (e.g. Jupyter or HTML Preview) 
2. Render:
`<audio controls autoplay src="http://media.w3.org/2010/07/bunny/04-Death_Becomes_Fur.oga"></audio>`
3. Observe that the controls are greyed out and the audio does not play

This is broken from 1.13 on, before that previewing audio just worked.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: unknown

data.title: Unable to uninstall a plugin
data.body:

data.title: No longer possible to drop a folder into Code to open folder
data.body:
This is a regression from the Electron update and seems to be https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9840

I would argue that this blocks an Electron update unless we find a workaround. The problem is that during drag we no longer can find out if the dragged resource is a file or folder. Only when dropping it seems we can find out.

We need to know if a folder is dropped vs file to show different drop feedback:
* dropping a folder shows a full drop feedback over the entire window to indicate that you open the folder
* dropping a file is showing individual feedback depending on where you drop (over the explorer: copy file into the folder, over the editor: open the folder)

/cc @kieferrm @Tyriar @roblourens

data.title: EH debugging ("inspector"): can break before sourcemaps are done loading
data.body:
OS: elementary OS 0.4.1 Loki (Built on "Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS")

- use hello world extension
- set breakpoint in `extension.ts:12`
- F5 and trigger "hello" command

Observe:
breakpoint is hit and after some time sourcemap loading errors appear in debug console and the STACKTRACE refers to the extensionHostProcess.js instead of *.ts:
![2017-08-15_12-22-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29312405-6b3b7186-81b5-11e7-87dd-67adb193f5a0.png)

Loading the sourcemap urls in a browser works fine. 
Loading sourcemaps works fine on macOS.

data.title: Error when excluding files with a backslash in the filename
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:06:21.685Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.3
gitlens|eam|4.3.3
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
git-project-manager|fel|1.3.2
docomment|k--|0.0.17
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
mono-debug|ms-|0.15.7
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
vim|vsc|0.9.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a file to the project folder containing a backslash, e.g. `c:\log\example.txt`
  a. File appears in Explorer view
2. Add a rule to the files.exclude setting, e.g.: `"**/**\log\**": true`
  a. File is excluded from Explorer view
  b. Error appears for settings.json in Problems view: `Invalid escape character in string`
3. Replace rule in files.exclude to escape backslashes, e.g.: `"**/**\\log\\**": true`
  a. File is not excluded from Explorer view
  b. No error appears for settings.json in Problems view

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature request: Integrated Terminal: A way to run selected text or current line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:09:15.006Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.13.0-39-generic

The `workbench.action.terminal.runSelectedText` runs selected text _or the current file_. I'd prefer a way to run selected text _or the current line_.
